encodingDesc.p: This file encoded to comply with EpiDoc Guidelines and Schema version 8 http://www.stoa.org/epidoc/gl/5/

bibl.title: New Testament Papyri and the Transmission of the New Testament.

series.title: Egypt Exploration Society. Graeco-Roman Memoirs. No.

bibl.title: Oxyrhynchus. A City and Its Texts
bibl.author: EPP, Eldon Jay

bibl.note: [Introduction.] - New Testament papyri at Oxyrhynchus: Their antiquity and quantity. - New Testament papyri at Oxyrhynchus: Their textual character and significance for establishing a critical text and text types: Oxyrhynchus papyri and the New Testament critical text; - Oxyrhynchus as a microcosm for New Testament text-types. - New Testament papyri at Oxyrhynchus: Their provenance and socio-cultural-intellectual context: Provenance of other early New Testament manuscripts; - General literary activity in Oxyrhynchus; - Surviving literary works at Oxyrhynchus; - Evidence of literary-critical scholarship at Oxyrhynchus; - Literary criticism and the Oxyrhynchus New Testament papyri. - Conclusion.
